Download our look back at 2017 and get an insider's look at what's ahead for civil liberties in 2018.
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

This year has been an unprecedented test of America's democracy, unlike any I've seen in my previous 10 years with the ACLU of Connecticut. People have suffered because of this year's attacks on justice, liberty, and equality. Yet your commitment gives me hope.

Persistence is our secret weapon. Look at the civil liberties you defended in 2017, and learn what you can make possible in 2018.

In 2017, you made it possible for a music minister, protester, new mother, and many more people across Connecticut to seek justice through the courts. You made our state a safer place for LGBTQ children by passing a ban on conversion therapy. You protected more innocent people from having their property taken by the government through civil asset forfeiture. You gave more people a chance at fairness under the law by passing four criminal justice reform laws. And you beat back 11 state legislative proposals that would have undermined liberty.

But our work is far from finished. Read our year in review for a look at what's ahead.

Make no mistake – there have been dark days in 2017. Justice, equality, and freedom have sometimes felt far from reach. But persistence is our secret weapon at the ACLU of Connecticut.

Thank you for standing with civil liberties,

David McGuire
Executive Director
ACLU of Connecticut
